content: b m h w b be my hot water bottle by kristen finlay 1 www skeinyarn com pattern copyright © kristen finlay skein top draw socks 1 skein 85% superwash merino 15% using judy s magic cast on see online resources below nylon 437 yards/400 meters in 95g yarn held double cast on 76 stitches 38 stitches on each needle remember to cast on with yarn held double if you re using leftover bits and pieces it might be helpful to know needle 1 k2 *p2 k2* repeat to end of needle 1 that the pictured cosy weighed 95g in total needle 2 k2 *p2 k2* repeat to end of needle 2 continue to work in pattern with yarn held double have 38 sts x 32 sts in 10 cm/4 in 2x2 fun swapping colours throughout either striping colour ribbed pattern with yarn held blocking or both try using two different colours held double together which will give an interesting marled effect the picture shows two different colours of top draw socks 3 75 mm/us 5 circular needle held together throughout the first colour block and bind- off colour uses nori and midlands held together the next colour block uses midlands and barley and the third tapestry needle to weave in ends colour block uses barley and metallurgy work in pattern until piece measures approx 44cm/17 or desired length unblocked 11cm wide x 44cm long bind off using the miraculous elastic bind off see online resources below knit from the bottom up in a 2x2 enjoy ribbed tube the bmhwb is designed to fit snugly and will stretch to fit a standard hot-water bottle measuring approx 21cm wide x 34cm long if you would like a looser fit cast on 8 sts more than the pattern suggests 84 sts judy s magic cast on instructions are for magic loop method but you can alter this to http //knitty com/issuespring06/featmagiccaston html use double points if you prefer
